conclusion: There are four objects above the slabs, illuminated by a light source, casting shadows A, B, C, and D.
When the light source moves forward above the objects, the shadows cast by the objects will also move forward.
As the light source moves forward, the angle of the light hitting the objects will change, causing the shadows to become smaller.
A, B, C, and D will all move forward and become smaller as the light source moves forward above the objects.
